CatDescriptText: Mr. Frank Roilton, 109 East Jefferson Street, North Side, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 26, 1957, pg. 4, with question: "Do you believe we should have a state law forbidding strikes of trolley cars, buses, and taxicabs?" answer reads: "Yes, I think there should be a state law. It's pretty hard to walk to and from work.  The law should keep the street cars and other means of transportation on the street until there is an agreement between management and labor, and things can be returned to normal again."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frank Roilton wearing moustache, light colored square patterned shirt, and light colored suit jacket, standing in front of yard with house and light colored building with one window
